result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 4/28/2016, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant can ask for an extension if not paid in full.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and drug treatment.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.
COURT HAS NO OBJECTION TO THIS CASE BEING TRANSFERRED TO DODGE COUNTY.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Gerald Gerke

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.
Court approve for payment plan.
Received, filed and signed. ORDER. Copies distributed to parties.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for payment plan.
from defendant requesting a payment plan.
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.  10 days HOC, consecutive.  Due & owing

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case scheduled for motion hearing and final pretrial.  Defendant is withdrawing motion, and requests to resolve the case.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and drug treatment.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.

COURT HAS NO OBJECTION TO THIS CASE BEING TRANSFERRED TO DODGE COUNTY.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 4/28/2016, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant can ask for an extension if not paid in full.

Received and filed:

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Jury trial scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Attorney Lin has agreed to take this case for attorney Reyna Morales, and requests time to go over discovery.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 1/9/2015 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Attorney Morales is sick, and unable to appear.  Attorney Lin contacted the court by phone and text to get a new date.  Court will try to do plea and sentencing on next court date, if not in trial.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 12/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin Hannah Kolberg.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 9/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Benjamin Verhulst, student intern under the supervision of Chad Wozniak for Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Gerald Gerke in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
